project.name: Ada
project.description: Gentoo Specific Support for Programming in Ada.

longdescription.p: This project deals with various Ada compilers and libraries in portage. At present two gnat compilers are provided, gnat-gcc by FSF and gnat-gpl by AdaCore. Both are SLOtted and made to coexist, with the selection of the active compiler performed via eselect gnat module. There are multiple Ada libraries unde dev-ada, which are tuned to use these multiple compilers. Selection of the active lib variant is done simultaneously with the selection of the active compiler via the same eselect gnat command. More details on the setup can be found in the resources section below and the lengthy discussion that lead to this system in bug #111340.

This setup is in the transitional stage at the moment, however nearing completion. Its progress can be tracked in the bug #137268. "Old-style" dev-lang/gnat and dev-ada/asis packages will be removed when the new setup is fully functional and thus are deprecated (dev-ada/asis is already masked, dev-ada/asis-{gcc,gpl} should be used instead). One remaining consideration is dev-lang/gnat-3.15p, which still seem to have some preferential use by some people. However that version no longer works with new binutils and required an antiquated gcc backend. Help is sought by those interested to keep this version alive, in case there is such desire.
